newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHENS BOURSE STARTS TRADE WITH NINE MEMBERS.
newsitem.headline: ATHENS BOURSE STARTS TRADE WITH NINE MEMBERS.

text.p: The Athens stock exchange was resuming trade on Wednesday as nine member brokerages had been admitted to the floor and had terminals swithced on, sources at the exchange told Reuters.
Trading was thin with less than 14 million drachmas worth of trades.
The nine securities firms were Alpha Brokerage, Egnatia Securities, Sigma Securities, Ionian Securities, Petropoulakis Brokerage, Hrysochoides brokerage and Macedonia-Thrace Securities, sources said.
More member brokers were being admitted gradually. The general share index was down 0.22 percent at 918.74 points.
The crisis was defused after the national economy ministry and the brokers association reached common ground late on Tuesday on ways to resolve the deadlock after the Delta Securities scandal.
Officials said on Tuesday the bourse would open late today but they expected it to be back to normal on Thursday. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
